meanings.definition: A pungent-tasting root vegetable usually eaten raw in salads.
meanings.sent1: I added sliced radishes to my salad for a crunchy texture.
meanings.sent2: Radishes are a common ingredient in many salad recipes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit swapped the carrots for radishes in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sharp and unexpected as the taste of radishes.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red color of radishes makes them stand out in any dish.

meanings.definition: The plant of the mustard family that produces this root.
meanings.sent1: The radishes in the garden were growing rapidly under the sun.
meanings.sent2: Farmers plant radishes to harvest the crunchy roots.
meanings.sent3: The radishes in the field whispered secrets to the neighboring plants.
meanings.sent4: The radishes swayed in the breeze, dancing to an invisible tune.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh radishes filled the air, signaling a bountiful harvest.
